00059 extern char *progname;
00060 extern int verbose;
00061 
00062 #define vprint(fmt, arg...) if (verbose > 0) printf(fmt, ##arg)
00063 #define verrprint(fmt, arg...) if (verbose >= 0) fprintf(stderr, fmt, ##arg)

00065 static struct module_backfs_ops *backfs_ops[LDD_MT_LAST];
00066 
00067 void fatal(void)
00068 {
00069         verbose = 0;
00070         fprintf(stderr, "\n%s FATAL: ", progname);
00071 }
00072 
00073 int run_command(char *cmd, int cmdsz)
00074 {
00075         char log[] = "/tmp/run_command_logXXXXXX";
00076         int fd = -1, rc;
00077 
00078         if ((cmdsz - strlen(cmd)) < 6) {
00079                 fatal();
00080                 fprintf(stderr, "Command buffer overflow: %.*s...\n",
00081                         cmdsz, cmd);
00082                 return ENOMEM;
00083         }
00084 
00085         if (verbose > 1) {
00086                 printf("cmd: %s\n", cmd);
00087         } else {
00088                 if ((fd = mkstemp(log)) >= 0) {
00089                         close(fd);
00090                         strcat(cmd, " >");
00091                         strcat(cmd, log);
00092                 }
00093         }
00094         strcat(cmd, " 2>&1");
00095 
00096         /* Can't use popen because we need the rv of the command */
00097         rc = system(cmd);
00098         if (rc && (fd >= 0)) {
00099                 char buf[128];
00100                 FILE *fp;
00101                 fp = fopen(log, "r");
00102                 if (fp) {
00103                         while (fgets(buf, sizeof(buf), fp) != NULL) {
00104                                 printf("   %s", buf);
00105                         }
00106                         fclose(fp);
00107                 }
00108         }
00109         if (fd >= 0)
00110                 remove(log);
00111         return rc;
00112 }
00113 
00114 int add_param(char *buf, char *key, char *val)
00115 {
00116         int end = sizeof(((struct lustre_disk_data *)0)->ldd_params);
00117         int start = strlen(buf);
00118         int keylen = 0;
00119 
00120         if (key)
00121                 keylen = strlen(key);
00122         if (start + 1 + keylen + strlen(val) >= end) {
00123                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: params are too long-\n%s %s%s\n",
00124                         progname, buf, key ? key : "", val);
00125                 return 1;
00126         }
00127 
00128         sprintf(buf + start, " %s%s", key ? key : "", val);
00129         return 0;
00130 }
00131 
00132 int get_param(char *buf, char *key, char **val)
00133 {
00134         int i, key_len = strlen(key);
00135         char *ptr;
00136 
00137         ptr = strstr(buf, key);
00138         if (ptr) {
00139                 *val = strdup(ptr + key_len);
00140                 if (*val == NULL)
00141                         return ENOMEM;
00142 
00143                 for (i = 0; i < strlen(*val); i++)
00144                         if (((*val)[i] == ' ') || ((*val)[i] == '\0'))
00145                                 break;
00146 
00147                 (*val)[i] = '\0';
00148                 return 0;
00149         }
00150 
00151         return ENOENT;
00152 }
00153 
00154 int append_param(char *buf, char *key, char *val, char sep)
00155 {
00156         int key_len, i, offset, old_val_len;
00157         char *ptr = NULL, str[1024];
00158 
00159         if (key)
00160                 ptr = strstr(buf, key);
00161 
00162         /* key doesn't exist yet, so just add it */
00163         if (ptr == NULL)
00164                 return add_param(buf, key, val);
00165 
00166         key_len = strlen(key);
00167 
00168         /* Copy previous values to str */
00169         for (i = 0; i < sizeof(str); ++i) {
00170                 if ((ptr[i+key_len] == ' ') || (ptr[i+key_len] == '\0'))
00171                         break;
00172                 str[i] = ptr[i+key_len];
00173         }
00174         if (i == sizeof(str))
00175                 return E2BIG;
00176         old_val_len = i;
00177 
00178         offset = old_val_len+key_len;
00179 
00180         /* Move rest of buf to overwrite previous key and value */
00181         for (i = 0; ptr[i+offset] != '\0'; ++i)
00182                 ptr[i] = ptr[i+offset];
00183 
00184         ptr[i] = '\0';
00185 
00186         snprintf(str+old_val_len, sizeof(str)-old_val_len, "%c%s", sep, val);
00187 
00188         return add_param(buf, key, str);
00189 }
00190 
00191 char *strscat(char *dst, char *src, int buflen)
00192 {
00193         dst[buflen - 1] = 0;
00194         if (strlen(dst) + strlen(src) >= buflen) {
00195                 fprintf(stderr, "string buffer overflow (max %d): '%s' + '%s'"
00196                         "\n", buflen, dst, src);
00197                 exit(EOVERFLOW);
00198         }
00199         return strcat(dst, src);
00200 }
00201 
00202 char *strscpy(char *dst, char *src, int buflen)
00203 {
00204         dst[0] = 0;
00205         return strscat(dst, src, buflen);
00206 }
00207 
00208 int check_mtab_entry(char *spec1, char *spec2, char *mtpt, char *type)
00209 {
00210         FILE *fp;
00211         struct mntent *mnt;
00212 
00213         fp = setmntent(MOUNTED, "r");
00214         if (fp == NULL)
00215                 return 0;
00216 
00217         while ((mnt = getmntent(fp)) != NULL) {
00218                 if ((strcmp(mnt->mnt_fsname, spec1) == 0 ||
00219                      strcmp(mnt->mnt_fsname, spec2) == 0) &&
00220                     (mtpt == NULL || strcmp(mnt->mnt_dir, mtpt) == 0) &&
00221                     (type == NULL || strcmp(mnt->mnt_type, type) == 0)) {
00222                         endmntent(fp);
00223                         return(EEXIST);
00224                 }
00225         }
00226         endmntent(fp);
00227 
00228         return 0;
00229 }
00230 
00231 #define PROC_DIR        "/proc/"
00232 static int mtab_is_proc(const char *mtab)
00233 {
00234         char path[16];
00235 
00236         if (readlink(mtab, path, sizeof(path)) < 0)
00237                 return 0;
00238 
00239         if (strncmp(path, PROC_DIR, strlen(PROC_DIR)))
00240                 return 0;
00241 
00242         return 1;
00243 }

00245 #ifdef HAVE_LIBMOUNT
00246 
00247 # include <libmount/libmount.h>
00248 
00249 /*
00250  * The libmount is part of util-linux since 2.18.
00251  * We use it to update utab to avoid umount would
00252  * blocked in some rare case.
00253  */
00254 int update_utab_entry(struct mount_opts *mop)
00255 {
00256         struct libmnt_fs *fs = mnt_new_fs();
00257         struct libmnt_update *upd;
00258         int rc;
00259 
00260         mnt_fs_set_source(fs, mop->mo_source);
00261         mnt_fs_set_target(fs, mop->mo_target);
00262         mnt_fs_set_fstype(fs, "lustre");
00263         mnt_fs_set_attributes(fs, "lustre");
00264 
00265         upd = mnt_new_update();
00266         if (!upd)
00267                 return -ENOMEM;
00268 
00269         rc = mnt_update_set_fs(upd, mop->mo_nomtab ? MS_REMOUNT : 0, NULL, fs);
00270         if (rc == 1) /* update is unnecessary */
00271                 rc = 0;
00272         if (rc) {
00273                 fprintf(stderr,
00274                         "error: failed to save utab entry: rc = %d\n", rc);
00275         } else {
00276                 rc = mnt_update_table(upd, NULL);
00277         }
00278 
00279         mnt_free_update(upd);
00280         mnt_free_fs(fs);
00281 
00282         return rc;
00283 }
00284 #else
00285 int update_utab_entry(struct mount_opts *mop)
00286 {
00287         return 0;
00288 }
00289 #endif /* HAVE_LIBMOUNT */
00290 
00291 int update_mtab_entry(char *spec, char *mtpt, char *type, char *opts,
00292                 int flags, int freq, int pass)
00293 {
00294         FILE *fp;
00295         struct mntent mnt;
00296         int rc = 0;
00297 
00298         /* Don't update mtab if it is linked to any file in /proc direcotry.*/
00299         if (mtab_is_proc(MOUNTED))
00300                 return 0;
00301 
00302         mnt.mnt_fsname = spec;
00303         mnt.mnt_dir = mtpt;
00304         mnt.mnt_type = type;
00305         mnt.mnt_opts = opts ? opts : "";
00306         mnt.mnt_freq = freq;
00307         mnt.mnt_passno = pass;
00308 
00309         fp = setmntent(MOUNTED, "a+");
00310         if (fp == NULL) {
00311                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: setmntent(%s): %s:",
00312                         progname, MOUNTED, strerror (errno));
00313                 rc = 16;
00314         } else {
00315                 if ((addmntent(fp, &mnt)) == 1) {
00316                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: addmntent: %s:",
00317                                 progname, strerror (errno));
00318                         rc = 16;
00319                 }
00320                 endmntent(fp);
00321         }
00322 
00323         return rc;
00324 }
00325 
00326 /* Search for opt in mntlist, returning true if found.
00327  */
00328 static int in_mntlist(char *opt, char *mntlist)
00329 {
00330         char *ml, *mlp, *item, *ctx = NULL;
00331 
00332         if (!(ml = strdup(mntlist))) {
00333                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: out of memory\n", progname);
00334                 exit(1);
00335         }
00336         mlp = ml;
00337         while ((item = strtok_r(mlp, ",", &ctx))) {
00338                 if (!strcmp(opt, item))
00339                         break;
00340                 mlp = NULL;
00341         }
00342         free(ml);
00343         return (item != NULL);
00344 }
00345 
00346 /* Issue a message on stderr for every item in wanted_mountopts that is not
00347  * present in mountopts.  The justwarn boolean toggles between error and
00348  * warning message.  Return an error count.
00349  */
00350 int check_mountfsoptions(char *mountopts, char *wanted_mountopts)
00351 {
00352         char *ml, *mlp, *item, *ctx = NULL;
00353         int errors = 0;
00354 
00355         if (!(ml = strdup(wanted_mountopts))) {
00356                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: out of memory\n", progname);
00357                 exit(1);
00358         }
00359         mlp = ml;
00360         while ((item = strtok_r(mlp, ",", &ctx))) {
00361                 if (!in_mntlist(item, mountopts)) {
00362                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: Error: mandatory mount option"
00363                                 " '%s' is missing\n", progname, item);
00364                         errors++;
00365                 }
00366                 mlp = NULL;
00367         }
00368         free(ml);
00369         return errors;
00370 }
00371 
00372 /* Trim embedded white space, leading and trailing commas from string s.
00373  */
00374 void trim_mountfsoptions(char *s)
00375 {
00376         char *p;
00377 
00378         for (p = s; *p; ) {
00379                 if (isspace(*p)) {
00380                         memmove(p, p + 1, strlen(p + 1) + 1);
00381                         continue;
00382                 }
00383                 p++;
00384         }
00385 
00386         while (s[0] == ',')
00387                 memmove(&s[0], &s[1], strlen(&s[1]) + 1);
00388 
00389         p = s + strlen(s) - 1;
00390         while (p >= s && *p == ',')
00391                 *p-- = '\0';
00392 }
00393 
00394 /* Setup a file in the first unused loop_device */
00395 int loop_setup(struct mkfs_opts *mop)
00396 {
00397         char loop_base[20];
00398         char l_device[64];
00399         int i, ret = 0;
00400 
00401         /* Figure out the loop device names */
00402         if (!access("/dev/loop0", F_OK | R_OK) ||
00403             !access("/dev/loop-control", F_OK | R_OK)) {
00404                 strcpy(loop_base, "/dev/loop\0");
00405         } else if (!access("/dev/loop/0", F_OK | R_OK)) {
00406                 strcpy(loop_base, "/dev/loop/\0");
00407         } else {
00408                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: can't access loop devices\n", progname);
00409                 return EACCES;
00410         }
00411 
00412         /* Find unused loop device */
00413         for (i = 0; i < MAX_LOOP_DEVICES; i++) {
00414                 char cmd[PATH_MAX];
00415                 int cmdsz = sizeof(cmd);
00416 
00417 #ifdef HAVE_LOOP_CTL_GET_FREE
00418                 ret = open("/dev/loop-control", O_RDWR);
00419                 if (ret < 0) {
00420                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: can't access loop control\n", progname);
00421                         return EACCES;
00422                 }
00423                 /* find or allocate a free loop device to use */
00424                 i = ioctl(ret, LOOP_CTL_GET_FREE);
00425                 close(ret);
00426                 if (i < 0) {
00427                         fprintf(stderr, "%s: access loop control error\n", progname);
00428                         return EACCES;
00429                 }
00430                 sprintf(l_device, "%s%d", loop_base, i);
00431 #else
00432                 sprintf(l_device, "%s%d", loop_base, i);
00433                 if (access(l_device, F_OK | R_OK))
00434                         break;
00435 #endif
00436                 snprintf(cmd, cmdsz, "losetup %s > /dev/null 2>&1", l_device);
00437                 ret = system(cmd);
00438 
00439                 /* losetup gets 1 (ret=256) for non-set-up device */
00440                 if (ret) {
00441                         /* Set up a loopback device to our file */
00442                         snprintf(cmd, cmdsz, "losetup %s %s", l_device,
00443                                  mop->mo_device);
00444                         ret = run_command(cmd, cmdsz);
00445                         if (ret == 256)
00446                                 /* someone else picked up this loop device
00447                                  * behind our back */
00448                                 continue;
00449                         if (ret) {
00450                                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: error %d on losetup: %s\n",
00451                                         progname, ret,
00452                                         ret >= 0 ? strerror(ret) : "");
00453                                 return ret;
00454                         }
00455                         strscpy(mop->mo_loopdev, l_device,
00456                                 sizeof(mop->mo_loopdev));
00457                         return ret;
00458                 }
00459         }
00460 
00461         fprintf(stderr, "%s: out of loop devices!\n", progname);
00462         return EMFILE;
00463 }
00464 
00465 int loop_cleanup(struct mkfs_opts *mop)
00466 {
00467         char cmd[150];
00468         int ret = 0;
00469 
00470         if ((mop->mo_flags & MO_IS_LOOP) && *mop->mo_loopdev) {
00471                 int tries;
00472 
00473                 sprintf(cmd, "losetup -d %s", mop->mo_loopdev);
00474                 for (tries = 0; tries < 3; tries++) {
00475                         ret = run_command(cmd, sizeof(cmd));
00476                         if (ret == 0)
00477                                 break;
00478                         sleep(1);
00479                 }
00480         }
00481 
00482         if (ret != 0)
00483                 fprintf(stderr, "cannot cleanup %s: rc = %d\n",
00484                         mop->mo_loopdev, ret);
00485         return ret;
00486 }
00487 
00488 int loop_format(struct mkfs_opts *mop)
00489 {
00490         int fd;
00491 
00492         if (mop->mo_device_kb == 0) {
00493                 fatal();
00494                 fprintf(stderr, "loop device requires a --device-size= "
00495                         "param\n");
00496                 return EINVAL;
00497         }
00498 
00499         fd = creat(mop->mo_device, S_IRUSR|S_IWUSR);
00500         if (fd < 0) {
00501                 fatal();
00502                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: Unable to create backing store: %s\n",
00503                         progname, strerror(errno));
00504                 return errno;
00505         }
00506 
00507         if (ftruncate(fd, mop->mo_device_kb * 1024) != 0) {
00508                 close(fd);
00509                 fatal();
00510                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: Unable to truncate backing store: %s\n",
00511                         progname, strerror(errno));
00512                 return errno;
00513         }
00514 
00515         close(fd);
00516         return 0;
00517 }
00518 
00519 #define DLSYM(prefix, sym, func)                                        \
00520         do {                                                            \
00521                 char _fname[64];                                        \
00522                 snprintf(_fname, sizeof(_fname), "%s_%s", prefix, #func); \
00523                 sym->func = (typeof(sym->func))dlsym(sym->dl_handle, _fname); \
00524         } while (0)
00525 
00534 struct module_backfs_ops *load_backfs_module(enum ldd_mount_type mount_type)
00535 {
00536         void *handle;
00537         char *error, filename[512], fsname[512], *name;
00538         struct module_backfs_ops *ops;
00539 
00540         /* This deals with duplicate ldd_mount_types resolving to same OSD layer
00541          * plugin (e.g. ext3/ldiskfs/ldiskfs2 all being ldiskfs) */
00542         strncpy(fsname, mt_type(mount_type), sizeof(fsname));
00543         name = fsname + sizeof("osd-") - 1;
00544 
00545         /* change osd- to osd_ */
00546         fsname[sizeof("osd-") - 2] = '_';
00547 
00548         snprintf(filename, sizeof(filename), PLUGIN_DIR"/mount_%s.so", fsname);
00549 
00550         handle = dlopen(filename, RTLD_LAZY);
00551 
00552         /* Check for $LUSTRE environment variable from test-framework.
00553          * This allows using locally built modules to be used.
00554          */
00555         if (handle == NULL) {
00556                 char *dirname;
00557                 dirname = getenv("LUSTRE");
00558                 if (dirname) {
00559                         snprintf(filename, sizeof(filename),
00560                                  "%s/utils/.libs/mount_%s.so",
00561                                  dirname, fsname);
00562                         handle = dlopen(filename, RTLD_LAZY);
00563                 }
00564         }
00565 
00566         /* Do not clutter up console with missing types */
00567         if (handle == NULL)
00568                 return NULL;
00569 
00570         ops = malloc(sizeof(*ops));
00571         if (ops == NULL) {
00572                 dlclose(handle);
00573                 return NULL;
00574         }
00575 
00576         ops->dl_handle = handle;
00577         dlerror(); /* Clear any existing error */
00578 
00579         DLSYM(name, ops, init);
00580         DLSYM(name, ops, fini);
00581         DLSYM(name, ops, read_ldd);
00582         DLSYM(name, ops, write_ldd);
00583         DLSYM(name, ops, is_lustre);
00584         DLSYM(name, ops, make_lustre);
00585         DLSYM(name, ops, prepare_lustre);
00586         DLSYM(name, ops, tune_lustre);
00587         DLSYM(name, ops, label_lustre);
00588         DLSYM(name, ops, enable_quota);
00589 
00590         error = dlerror();
00591         if (error != NULL) {
00592                 fatal();
00593                 fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", error);
00594                 dlclose(handle);
00595                 free(ops);
00596                 return NULL;
00597         }
00598 
00599         /* optional methods */
00600         DLSYM(name, ops, fix_mountopts);
00601 
00602         return ops;
00603 }
00604 
00609 void unload_backfs_module(struct module_backfs_ops *ops)
00610 {
00611         if (ops == NULL)
00612                 return;
00613 
00614         dlclose(ops->dl_handle);
00615         free(ops);
00616 }
00617 
00618 /* Return true if backfs_ops has operations for the given mount_type. */
00619 int backfs_mount_type_okay(enum ldd_mount_type mount_type)
00620 {
00621         if (unlikely(mount_type >= LDD_MT_LAST || mount_type < 0)) {
00622                 fatal();
00623                 fprintf(stderr, "fs type out of range %d\n", mount_type);
00624                 return 0;
00625         }
00626         if (backfs_ops[mount_type] == NULL) {
00627                 fatal();
00628                 fprintf(stderr, "unhandled/unloaded fs type %d '%s'\n",
00629                         mount_type, mt_str(mount_type));
00630                 return 0;
00631         }
00632         return 1;
00633 }
00634 
00635 /* Write the server config files */
00636 int osd_write_ldd(struct mkfs_opts *mop)
00637 {
00638         struct lustre_disk_data *ldd = &mop->mo_ldd;
00639         int ret;
00640 
00641         if (backfs_mount_type_okay(ldd->ldd_mount_type))
00642                 ret = backfs_ops[ldd->ldd_mount_type]->write_ldd(mop);
00643         else
00644                 ret = EINVAL;
00645 
00646         return ret;
00647 }
00648 
00649 /* Read the server config files */
00650 int osd_read_ldd(char *dev, struct lustre_disk_data *ldd)
00651 {
00652         int ret;
00653 
00654         if (backfs_mount_type_okay(ldd->ldd_mount_type))
00655                 ret = backfs_ops[ldd->ldd_mount_type]->read_ldd(dev, ldd);
00656         else
00657                 ret = EINVAL;
00658 
00659         return ret;
00660 }
00661 
00662 /* Was this device formatted for Lustre */
00663 int osd_is_lustre(char *dev, unsigned *mount_type)
00664 {
00665         int i;
00666 
00667         vprint("checking for existing Lustre data: ");
00668 
00669         for (i = 0; i < LDD_MT_LAST; ++i) {
00670                 if (backfs_ops[i] != NULL &&
00671                     backfs_ops[i]->is_lustre(dev, mount_type)) {
00672                         vprint("found\n");
00673                         return 1;
00674                 }
00675         }
00676 
00677         vprint("not found\n");
00678         return 0;
00679 }
00680 
00681 /* Build fs according to type */
00682 int osd_make_lustre(struct mkfs_opts *mop)
00683 {
00684         struct lustre_disk_data *ldd = &mop->mo_ldd;
00685         int ret;
00686 
00687         if (backfs_mount_type_okay(ldd->ldd_mount_type))
00688                 ret = backfs_ops[ldd->ldd_mount_type]->make_lustre(mop);
00689         else
00690                 ret = EINVAL;
00691 
00692         return ret;
00693 }
00694 
00695 int osd_prepare_lustre(struct mkfs_opts *mop,
00696                        char *wanted_mountopts, size_t len)
00697 {
00698         struct lustre_disk_data *ldd = &mop->mo_ldd;
00699         int ret;
00700 
00701         if (backfs_mount_type_okay(ldd->ldd_mount_type))
00702                 ret = backfs_ops[ldd->ldd_mount_type]->prepare_lustre(mop,
00703                                                         wanted_mountopts, len);
00704         else
00705                 ret = EINVAL;
00706 
00707         return ret;
00708 }
00709 
00710 int osd_fix_mountopts(struct mkfs_opts *mop, char *mountopts, size_t len)
00711 {
00712         struct lustre_disk_data *ldd = &mop->mo_ldd;
00713 
00714         if (!backfs_mount_type_okay(ldd->ldd_mount_type))
00715                 return EINVAL;
00716 
00717         if (backfs_ops[ldd->ldd_mount_type]->fix_mountopts == NULL)
00718                 return 0;
00719 
00720         return backfs_ops[ldd->ldd_mount_type]->fix_mountopts(mop, mountopts,
00721                                                               len);
00722 }
00723 
00724 int osd_tune_lustre(char *dev, struct mount_opts *mop)
00725 {
00726         struct lustre_disk_data *ldd = &mop->mo_ldd;
00727         int ret;
00728 
00729         if (backfs_mount_type_okay(ldd->ldd_mount_type))
00730                 ret = backfs_ops[ldd->ldd_mount_type]->tune_lustre(dev, mop);
00731         else
00732                 ret = EINVAL;
00733 
00734         return ret;
00735 }
00736 
00737 int osd_label_lustre(struct mount_opts *mop)
00738 {
00739         struct lustre_disk_data *ldd = &mop->mo_ldd;
00740         int ret;
00741 
00742         if (backfs_mount_type_okay(ldd->ldd_mount_type))
00743                 ret = backfs_ops[ldd->ldd_mount_type]->label_lustre(mop);
00744         else
00745                 ret = EINVAL;
00746

00749 
00750 /* Enable quota accounting */
00751 int osd_enable_quota(struct mkfs_opts *mop)
00752 {
00753         struct lustre_disk_data *ldd = &mop->mo_ldd;
00754         int ret;
00755 
00756         if (backfs_mount_type_okay(ldd->ldd_mount_type))
00757                 ret = backfs_ops[ldd->ldd_mount_type]->enable_quota(mop);
00758         else
00759                 ret = EINVAL;
00760 
00761         return ret;
00762 }
00763 
00764 int osd_init(void)
00765 {
00766         int i, rc, ret = EINVAL;
00767 
00768         for (i = 0; i < LDD_MT_LAST; ++i) {
00769                 rc = 0;
00770                 backfs_ops[i] = load_backfs_module(i);
00771                 if (backfs_ops[i] != NULL)
00772                         rc = backfs_ops[i]->init();
00773                 if (rc != 0) {
00774                         backfs_ops[i]->fini();
00775                         unload_backfs_module(backfs_ops[i]);
00776                         backfs_ops[i] = NULL;
00777                 } else
00778                         ret = 0;
00779         }
00780 
00781         return ret;
00782 }
00783 
00784 void osd_fini(void)
00785 {
00786         int i;
00787 
00788         for (i = 0; i < LDD_MT_LAST; ++i) {
00789                 if (backfs_ops[i] != NULL) {
00790                         backfs_ops[i]->fini();
00791                         unload_backfs_module(backfs_ops[i]);
00792                         backfs_ops[i] = NULL;
00793                 }
00794         }
00795 }
00796 
00797 __u64 get_device_size(char* device)
00798 {
00799         int ret, fd;
00800         __u64 size = 0;
00801 
00802         fd = open(device, O_RDONLY);
00803         if (fd < 0) {
00804                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: cannot open %s: %s\n",
00805                         progname, device, strerror(errno));
00806                 return 0;
00807         }
00808 
00809 #ifdef BLKGETSIZE64
00810         /* size in bytes. bz5831 */
00811         ret = ioctl(fd, BLKGETSIZE64, (void*)&size);
00812 #else
00813         {
00814                 __u32 lsize = 0;
00815                 /* size in blocks */
00816                 ret = ioctl(fd, BLKGETSIZE, (void*)&lsize);
00817                 size = (__u64)lsize * 512;
00818         }
00819 #endif
00820         close(fd);
00821         if (ret < 0) {
00822                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: size ioctl failed: %s\n",
00823                         progname, strerror(errno));
00824                 return 0;
00825         }
00826 
00827         vprint("device size = %juMB\n", (uintmax_t)(size >> 20));
00828         /* return value in KB */
00829         return size >> 10;
00830 }
00831 
00832 int file_create(char *path, __u64 size)
00833 {
00834         __u64 size_max;
00835         int ret;
00836         int fd;
00837 
00838         /*
00839          * Since "size" is in KB, the file offset it represents could overflow
00840          * off_t.
00841          */
00842         size_max = (off_t)1 << (_FILE_OFFSET_BITS - 1 - 10);
00843         if (size >= size_max) {
00844                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: %ju KB: Backing store size must be "
00845                         "smaller than %ju KB\n", progname, (uintmax_t) size,
00846                         (uintmax_t)size_max);
00847                 return EFBIG;
00848         }
00849 
00850         ret = access(path, F_OK);
00851         if (ret == 0) {
00852                 ret = unlink(path);
00853                 if (ret != 0)
00854                         return errno;
00855         }
00856 
00857         fd = creat(path, S_IRUSR|S_IWUSR);
00858         if (fd < 0) {
00859                 fatal();
00860                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: Unable to create backing store: %s\n",
00861                         progname, strerror(errno));
00862                 return errno;
00863         }
00864 
00865         ret = ftruncate(fd, size * 1024);
00866         close(fd);
00867         if (ret != 0) {
00868                 fatal();
00869                 fprintf(stderr, "%s: Unable to truncate backing store: %s\n",
00870                         progname, strerror(errno));
00871                 return errno;
00872         }
00873 
00874         return 0;
00875 }
